0.name: Prairie
0.text: The word prairie is a keyword for the Cartographer bonus card. (This error was corrected in print by December 2019.)

1.name: Rerolling dice
1.text: Regular reroll rules apply whenever you have the opportunity to gain food from the birdfeeder.

2.name: Powers
2.text: Only powers of birds played on a player mat can be used. In particular, birds with the power "This bird counts double toward the end-of-round goal, if it qualifies for the goal." (e.g., Cetti's Warbler) does not count double toward the \textbf{[card] in hand} end-of-round goal.

3.name: Sets of [egg][egg][egg] in [forest][grassland][wetland]
3.text: A player's score for this goal tile is the minimum of the counts of eggs in each of their habitats.

4.name: Once between turns
4.text: You may use a pink power during another player's turn after your last turn of the game.

5.name: Once between turns
5.text: You may activate each "once between turns" power on a bird on your player mat once between each of your turns.

6.name: Rerolling dice
6.text: You may only reroll dice when gaining food from the birdfeeder and not when gaining food from the supply.

7.name: End of your turn
7.text: You may perform an action even if it precludes you from performing an action required at the end of your turn (e.g., discarding a [card] from your hand at the end of a turn in which you activated the Black Tern's power).

8.name: End of your turn
8.text: If you can (or must) do more than one action "at the end of your turn", you can perform those actions in any order.

9.name: End-of-round goal
9.text: A card in your hand with the power, "This bird counts double toward the end-of-round goal, if it qualifies for the goal." (e.g., Cetti's Warbler), does not count toward end-of-round goals.

10.name: Violet
10.text: The word violet is a keyword for the Photographer bonus card. (This keyword currently occurs only on the \textbf{Violet-Green Swallow}, which already contains another keyword for Photographer.)

11.name: Action
11.text: Unless specifically stated, your actions are assumed only to affect your player mat, supply, etc. (For example, the American Avocet's power cannot be used to lay an [egg] on another player's bird.)

12.name: Once between turns
12.text: You may not use a pink power during your turn (when an opponent performs an action that would otherwise enable using such a power).

13.name: It becomes a tucked card
13.text: Cards whose powers include the phrase "it becomes a tucked card" (e.g., Common Buzzard) qualify for the Citizen Scientist bonus card when the Automa has drawn it.

14.name: Resources
14.text: Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.

15.name: Alternative Cost
15.text: If you use a bird's power to play in the same habitat a bird an alternative food cost specified via an asterisk next to its food cost, you may pay the alternative cost (which thus counts as paying the bird's ``normal food cost'') instead of paying its food cost.

16.name: Appendix
16.text: If information printed on a card conflicts with the card's appendix entry, the information on the card takes precedence. (See American Oystercatcher, Belted Kingfisher, and Eastern Kingbird.)

17.name: [wild] [wild] ➔ [wild]
17.text: You may substitute 2 [wild] for any 1 food in a bird's food cost whenever you play a bird, including outside the scope of the "play a bird" action.
